channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Enhancing social network hate detection using back translation and GPT-3 augmentations during training and test-time
item.description: Social media platforms have become an essential means of communication, but they also serve as a breeding ground for hateful content.

item.title: Evaluation and Optimization of Gradient Compression for Distributed Deep Learning
item.description: To accelerate distributed training, many gradient compression methods have been proposed to alleviate the communication bottleneck in synchronous stochastic gradient descent (S-SGD), but their efficacy in real-world applications still remains unclear.

item.title: Re-Benchmarking Pool-Based Active Learning for Binary Classification
item.description: Active learning is a paradigm that significantly enhances the performance of machine learning models when acquiring labeled data is expensive.

item.title: Scalable Resource Management for Dynamic MEC: An Unsupervised Link-Output Graph Neural Network Approach
item.description: However, the dynamics of edge networks raise two challenges in neural network (NN)-based optimization methods: low scalability and high training costs.

item.title: Annotator Consensus Prediction for Medical Image Segmentation with Diffusion Models
item.description: A major challenge in the segmentation of medical images is the large inter- and intra-observer variability in annotations provided by multiple experts.

item.title: PINNacle: A Comprehensive Benchmark of Physics-Informed Neural Networks for Solving PDEs
item.description: In addition to providing a standardized means of assessing performance, PINNacle also offers an in-depth analysis to guide future research, particularly in areas such as domain decomposition methods and loss reweighting for handling multi-scale problems and complex geometry.

item.title: Partial-Label Regression
item.description: Our proposed methods are theoretically grounded and can be compatible with any models, optimizers, and losses.

item.title: Pragmatic Inference with a CLIP Listener for Contrastive Captioning
item.description: We propose a simple yet effective and robust method for contrastive captioning: generating discriminative captions that distinguish target images from very similar alternative distractor images.

item.title: OMS-DPM: Optimizing the Model Schedule for Diffusion Probabilistic Models
item.description: Diffusion probabilistic models (DPMs) are a new class of generative models that have achieved state-of-the-art generation quality in various domains.

item.title: A Gromov--Wasserstein Geometric View of Spectrum-Preserving Graph Coarsening
item.description: The study includes a set of experiments to support the theory and method, including approximating the GW distance, preserving the graph spectrum, classifying graphs using spectral information, and performing regression using graph convolutional networks.

item.title: The Split Matters: Flat Minima Methods for Improving the Performance of GNNs
item.description: We investigate flat minima methods and combinations of those methods for training graph neural networks (GNNs).

item.title: Relation-Aware Diffusion Model for Controllable Poster Layout Generation
item.description: To advance research in this field, we have constructed a poster layout dataset named CGL-Dataset V2.

item.title: Optimal Exploration for Model-Based RL in Nonlinear Systems
item.description: A commonly applied approach is to first explore the environment (exploration), learn an accurate model of it (system identification), and then compute an optimal controller with the minimum cost on this estimated system (policy optimization).

item.title: Unbalanced Diffusion Schr√∂dinger Bridge
item.description: Schr\"odinger bridges (SBs) provide an elegant framework for modeling the temporal evolution of populations in physical, chemical, or biological systems.

item.title: Human Preference Score v2: A Solid Benchmark for Evaluating Human Preferences of Text-to-Image Synthesis
item.description: By fine-tuning CLIP on HPD v2, we obtain Human Preference Score v2 (HPS v2), a scoring model that can more accurately predict text-generated images' human preferences.

item.title: PEACE: Cross-Platform Hate Speech Detection- A Causality-guided Framework
item.description: Hate speech detection refers to the task of detecting hateful content that aims at denigrating an individual or a group based on their religion, gender, sexual orientation, or other characteristics.

item.title: KoLA: Carefully Benchmarking World Knowledge of Large Language Models
item.description: The unprecedented performance of large language models (LLMs) necessitates improvements in evaluations.

item.title: Bridging the Gap between Decision and Logits in Decision-based Knowledge Distillation for Pre-trained Language Models
item.description: By combining the theoretical and empirical estimations of the decision distributions together, the estimation of logits can be successfully reduced to a simple root-finding problem.

item.title: Improving Reading Comprehension Question Generation with Data Augmentation and Overgenerate-and-rank
item.description: Reading comprehension is a crucial skill in many aspects of education, including language learning, cognitive development, and fostering early literacy skills in children.

item.title: ArtFusion: Arbitrary Style Transfer using Dual Conditional Latent Diffusion Models
item.description: Despite the promising results of conditional diffusion probabilistic models (cDM) in various generative tasks, their introduction to style transfer is challenging due to the requirement for paired training data.

item.title: Personalized Image Enhancement Featuring Masked Style Modeling
item.description: Second, to allow this model to consider the contents of images, we propose a novel training scheme where we download images from Flickr and create pseudo input and retouched image pairs using a degrading model.

item.title: COSA: Concatenated Sample Pretrained Vision-Language Foundation Model
item.description: Due to the limited scale and quality of video-text training corpus, most vision-language foundation models employ image-text datasets for pretraining and primarily focus on modeling visually semantic representations while disregarding temporal semantic representations and correlations.

item.title: Enlarged Large Margin Loss for Imbalanced Classification
item.description: Although, by using LDAM loss, it is possible to obtain large margins for the minority classes and small margins for the majority classes, the relevance to a large margin, which is included in the original softmax cross entropy loss, is not be clarified yet.

item.title: SIGHT: A Large Annotated Dataset on Student Insights Gathered from Higher Education Transcripts
item.description: To overcome this challenge, we propose a set of best practices for using large language models (LLMs) to cheaply classify the comments at scale.

item.title: Semantic HELM: An Interpretable Memory for Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Then we feed these tokens to a pretrained language model that serves the agent as memory and provides it with a coherent and interpretable representation of the past.

item.title: Neural models for Factual Inconsistency Classification with Explanations
item.description: The proposed system first predicts inconsistent spans from claim and context; and then uses them to predict inconsistency types and inconsistent entity types (when inconsistency is due to entities).

item.title: LVLM-eHub: A Comprehensive Evaluation Benchmark for Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) have recently played a dominant role in multimodal vision-language learning.

item.title: Modularity Trumps Invariance for Compositional Robustness
item.description: In this work we develop a compositional image classification task where, given a few elemental corruptions, models are asked to generalize to compositions of these corruptions.

item.title: Datasets and Benchmarks for Offline Safe Reinforcement Learning
item.description: This paper presents a comprehensive benchmarking suite tailored to offline safe reinforcement learning (RL) challenges, aiming to foster progress in the development and evaluation of safe learning algorithms in both the training and deployment phases.

item.title: ChessGPT: Bridging Policy Learning and Language Modeling
item.description: Thus, we propose ChessGPT, a GPT model bridging policy learning and language modeling by integrating data from these two sources in Chess games.

item.title: Voting Booklet Bias: Stance Detection in Swiss Federal Communication
item.description: We then use our best model to analyze the stance of utterances extracted from the Swiss federal voting booklet concerning the Swiss popular votes of September 2022, which is the main goal of this project.

item.title: Macaw-LLM: Multi-Modal Language Modeling with Image, Audio, Video, and Text Integration
item.description: Although instruction-tuned large language models (LLMs) have exhibited remarkable capabilities across various NLP tasks, their effectiveness on other data modalities beyond text has not been fully studied.

item.title: Opinion Tree Parsing for Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: To address these challenges, we propose an opinion tree parsing model, aiming to parse all the sentiment elements from an opinion tree, which is much faster, and can explicitly reveal a more comprehensive and complete aspect-level sentiment structure.

item.title: Multi-Temporal Relationship Inference in Urban Areas
item.description: Specifically, we propose a solution to Trial with a graph learning scheme, which includes a spatially evolving graph neural network (SEENet) with two collaborative components: spatially evolving graph convolution module (SEConv) and spatially evolving self-supervised learning strategy (SE-SSL).

item.title: Fast Training of Diffusion Models with Masked Transformers
item.description: For masked training, we introduce an asymmetric encoder-decoder architecture consisting of a transformer encoder that operates only on unmasked patches and a lightweight transformer decoder on full patches.

item.title: Segment Any Point Cloud Sequences by Distilling Vision Foundation Models
item.description: Recent advancements in vision foundation models (VFMs) have opened up new possibilities for versatile and efficient visual perception.

item.title: RecFusion: A Binomial Diffusion Process for 1D Data for Recommendation
item.description: In this paper we propose RecFusion, which comprise a set of diffusion models for recommendation.

item.title: Seeing the Pose in the Pixels: Learning Pose-Aware Representations in Vision Transformers
item.description: Both PAAT and PAAB surpass their respective backbone Transformers by up to 9. 8% in real-world action recognition and 21. 8% in multi-view robotic video alignment.

item.title: Class-Conditional Conformal Prediction With Many Classes
item.description: Standard conformal prediction methods provide a marginal coverage guarantee, which means that for a random test point, the conformal prediction set contains the true label with a user-chosen probability.

item.title: WizMap: Scalable Interactive Visualization for Exploring Large Machine Learning Embeddings
item.description: Machine learning models often learn latent embedding representations that capture the domain semantics of their training data.

item.title: Can Language Models Teach Weaker Agents? Teacher Explanations Improve Students via Theory of Mind
item.description: We decompose the teaching problem along four axes: (1) if teacher's test time intervention improve student predictions, (2) when it is worth explaining a data point, (3) how the teacher should personalize explanations to better teach the student, and (4) if teacher explanations also improve student performance on future unexplained data.

item.title: Crowd-Powered Photo Enhancement Featuring an Active Learning Based Local Filter
item.description: Existing photo enhancement methods are either not content-aware or not local; therefore, we propose a crowd-powered local enhancement method for content-aware local enhancement, which is achieved by asking crowd workers to locally optimize parameters for image editing functions.

item.title: Learnable Weight Initialization for Volumetric Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Hybrid volumetric medical image segmentation models, combining the advantages of local convolution and global attention, have recently received considerable attention.

item.title: DreamSim: Learning New Dimensions of Human Visual Similarity using Synthetic Data
item.description: Furthermore, our metric outperforms both prior learned metrics and recent large vision models on these tasks.

item.title: Harvard Glaucoma Fairness: A Retinal Nerve Disease Dataset for Fairness Learning and Fair Identity Normalization
item.description: To address this gap, we introduce Harvard Glaucoma Fairness (Harvard-GF), a retinal nerve disease dataset with both 2D and 3D imaging data and balanced racial groups for glaucoma detection.

item.title: OpenOOD v1.5: Enhanced Benchmark for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: Out-of-Distribution (OOD) detection is critical for the reliable operation of open-world intelligent systems.

item.title: Learning by Analogy: Diverse Questions Generation in Math Word Problem
item.description: We then feed them to a question generator together with the scenario to obtain the corresponding diverse questions, forming a new MWP with a variety of questions and equations.

item.title: E-Calib: A Fast, Robust and Accurate Calibration Toolbox for Event Cameras
item.description: However, conventional image-based calibration techniques are not applicable due to the asynchronous, binary output of the sensor.

item.title: Estimating Generic 3D Room Structures from 2D Annotations
item.description: Based on these 2D annotations, we automatically reconstruct 3D plane equations for the structural elements and their spatial extent in the scene, and connect adjacent elements at the appropriate contact edges.

item.title: Improving Explainability of Disentangled Representations using Multipath-Attribution Mappings
item.description: We propose a framework that utilizes interpretable disentangled representations for downstream-task prediction.
